intro: Trinia carniolica, commonly known as the Carniolan trinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Trinia carniolica is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitats.
